definition:
Let $f: A \to B$ be a ring homomorphism. Let $\mathfrak{b}$ be an ideal
in $B$. Then it is easy to show that the inverse image of
$\mathfrak{b}$, that is $f^{-1}(\mathfrak{b})$, is an ideal in $A$, and
we call it a [*contracted ideal*]{}. A common notation for the
contracted ideal in this case is $\mathfrak{b}^c$.
